text.p: Japan's Nippon Credit Bank said in a statement on Thursday that a newspaper report about its restructuring plans was "groundless".

NCB's statement criticised the media report, which said NCB was going to withdraw from overseas operations, post losses for two consecutive years and was going to sell its Tokyo headquarters and Osaka branch office.
"However, the report is a groundless article," the statement said.

The NCB statement said the bank was continuing to consider business improvement plans, including restructuring steps, as it explained in a news conference on February 5, but at the moment nothing had been decided.
